name: Brief Self-Control Scale Survey
description: A new measure of individual differences in self-control into two large investigations of a broad spectrum of behaviors.
instructions: For each of the following statements please indicate how much each of the following statements reflects how you typically are.
reference: Tangney, J. P., Baumeister, R. F., & Boone, A. L. (2004). High self-control predicts good adjustment, less pathology, better grades, and interpersonal success. Journal of personality, 72(2), 271â€“324. https://doi.org/10.1111/j.0022-3506.2004.00263.x
